intro: Centaurium umbellatum f. alboroseum, commonly known as the white-flowered sandroot, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Gentianaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, clustered inflorescences that bear small, white to pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is native to regions of Europe and western Asia. Its foliage consists of narrow, grass-like leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. This variant is distinguished by its notably lighter flower color compared to the typical form of Centaurium umbellatum.
